titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 1, TAX CUTS AND JOBS ACT; PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 3312, SYSTEMIC RISK DESIGNATION IMPROVEMENT ACT OF 2017; AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 1, TAX CUTS AND JOBS ACT; PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 3312, SYSTEMIC RISK DESIGNATION IMPROVEMENT ACT OF 2017; AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 207

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Systemic Risk Designation Improvement Act of 2017
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to the conference report to accompany H.R. 1, to provide for reconciliation pursuant to titles II and V of the concurrent resolution on the budget for fiscal year 2018, by a yea-and-nay vote of 227 yeas to 203 nays, Roll No. 692.<P/>Rejected the Neal motion to recommit the conference report to the committee of conference, by a yea-and-nay vote of 191 yeas to 236 nays, Roll No. 691.<P/>H. Res. 667, the rule providing for consideration of the conference report to accompany the bill (H.R. 1) and the bill (H.R. 3312) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 233 ayes to 193 noes, Roll No. 689, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 233 yeas to 187 nays, Roll No. 688.

The House passed H.R. 3312, to amend the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act to specify when bank holding companies may be subject to certain enhanced supervision, by a yea-and-nay vote of 288 yeas to 130 nays, Roll No. 694.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 115-49, modified by the amendment printed in H. Rept. 115-474, shall be considered as adopted, in lieu of the amendment recommended by the Committee on Financial Services now printed in the bill.<P/>H. Res. 667, the rule providing for consideration of the conference report to accompany the bill (H.R. 1) and the bill (H.R. 3312) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 233 ayes to 193 noes, Roll No. 689, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 233 yeas to 187 nays, Roll No. 688.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Systemic Risk Designation Improvement Act of 2017
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to the conference report to accompany H.R. 1, to provide for reconciliation pursuant to titles II and V of the concurrent resolution on the budget for fiscal year 2018, by a yea-and-nay vote of 227 yeas to 203 nays, Roll No. 692.<P/>Rejected the Neal motion to recommit the conference report to the committee of conference, by a yea-and-nay vote of 191 yeas to 236 nays, Roll No. 691.<P/>H. Res. 667, the rule providing for consideration of the conference report to accompany the bill (H.R. 1) and the bill (H.R. 3312) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 233 ayes to 193 noes, Roll No. 689, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 233 yeas to 187 nays, Roll No. 688.

The House passed H.R. 3312, to amend the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act to specify when bank holding companies may be subject to certain enhanced supervision, by a yea-and-nay vote of 288 yeas to 130 nays, Roll No. 694.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 115-49, modified by the amendment printed in H. Rept. 115-474, shall be considered as adopted, in lieu of the amendment recommended by the Committee on Financial Services now printed in the bill.<P/>H. Res. 667, the rule providing for consideration of the conference report to accompany the bill (H.R. 1) and the bill (H.R. 3312) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 233 ayes to 193 noes, Roll No. 689, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 233 yeas to 187 nays, Roll No. 688.

extension.searchTitle: WOMEN IN AEROSPACE EDUCATION ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 207

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures. Consideration began Monday, December 18th.<P/>H.R. 4254, amended, to amend the National Science Foundation Authorization Act of 2002 to strengthen the aerospace workforce pipeline by the promotion of Robert Noyce Teacher Scholarship Program and National Aeronautics and Space Administration internship and fellowship opportunities to women, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 409 yeas to 17 nays, Roll No. 690; and

titleInfo.title: CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 1, TAX CUTS AND JOBS ACT

extension.searchTitle: CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 1, TAX CUTS AND JOBS ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 207

congVote.result: The SPEAKER pro tempore (during the vote). The Chair notes a disturbance in the gallery in contravention of the law and against the rules of the House.
So the conference report was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to the conference report to accompany H.R. 1, to provide for reconciliation pursuant to titles II and V of the concurrent resolution on the budget for fiscal year 2018, by a yea-and-nay vote of 227 yeas to 203 nays, Roll No. 692.

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Supporting Veterans in STEM Careers Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures. Consideration began Monday, December 18th.<P/>H.R. 4323, amended, to promote veteran involvement in STEM education, computer science, and scientific research, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 420 yeas with one voting ``nay'', Roll No. 693.

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 3312, to amend the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act to specify when bank holding companies may be subject to certain enhanced supervision, by a yea-and-nay vote of 288 yeas to 130 nays, Roll No. 694.

The House passed H.R. 3312, to amend the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act to specify when bank holding companies may be subject to certain enhanced supervision, by a yea-and-nay vote of 288 yeas to 130 nays, Roll No. 694.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 115-49, modified by the amendment printed in H. Rept. 115-474, shall be considered as adopted, in lieu of the amendment recommended by the Committee on Financial Services now printed in the bill.

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Combating Human Trafficking in Commercial Vehicles Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measure:<P/>S. 1536, to designate a human trafficking prevention coordinator and to expand the scope of activities authorized under the Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration's outreach and education program to include human trafficking prevention activities, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 418 yeas with one voting ``nay'', Roll No. 695.

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to the Speaker's approval of the Journal by a yea-and-nay vote of 227 yeas to 180 nays with one answering ``present'', Roll No. 696.

titleInfo.title: TAX CUTS AND JOBS ACT--CONFERENCE REPORT--MOTION TO PROCEED

extension.searchTitle: TAX CUTS AND JOBS ACT--CONFERENCE REPORT--MOTION TO PROCEED; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 207

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Senate began consideration of the conference report to accompany H.R. 1, to provide for reconciliation pursuant to titles II and V of the concurrent resolution on the budget for fiscal year 2018.<P/>During consideration of this measure today, Senate also took the following action:<P/>By 51 yeas to 48 nays (Vote No. 321), Senate agreed to the motion to proceed to consideration of the conference report to accompany the bill.

titleInfo.title: TAX CUTS AND JOBS ACT--CONFERENCE REPORT

extension.searchTitle: TAX CUTS AND JOBS ACT--CONFERENCE REPORT; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 207

congVote.result: Three-fifths of the Senators duly chosen and sworn not having voted in the affirmative, the motion is rejected.
The Senate recedes from its amendment and concurs in H.R. 1 with a further amendment.
